answers.text: conveying meaning in the form of non-word messages

qas.question: What is one example of nonverbal communication?
What is an example of a voluntary intent of a message related to nonverbal communication?
What is an example of an involuntary intent of a message related to nonverbal communication?
What percentage of human communication occurs through nonverbal facial expressions?
What is an example of paralanguage?
Dopamine levels can show what type of communication?
What percentage of human communication occurs through foot tapping?

plausible_answers.text: conveying meaning in the form of non-word messages

context: Nonverbal communication describes the process of <a0_0><b9_0>conveying meaning in the form of non-word messages<b9_0/><a0_0/>. Examples of nonverbal communication include haptic communication, chronemic communication, gestures, <a1_0>body language<a1_0/>, facial expression, eye contact, and how one dresses. <b6_0>Nonverbal communication<b6_0/> also relates to intent of a message. Examples of intent are voluntary, intentional movements like <a2_0>shaking a hand<a2_0/> or winking, as well as involuntary, such as <a3_0>sweating<a3_0/>. Speech also contains nonverbal elements known as paralanguage, e.g. rhythm, intonation, tempo, and stress. There may even be a pheromone component. Research has shown that up to <a4_0><b8_0>55%<b8_0/><a4_0/> of human communication may occur through <b5_0>non-verbal facial expressions<b5_0/>, and a further 38% through paralanguage. It affects communication most at the subconscious level and establishes <b7_0>trust<b7_0/>. Likewise, written texts include nonverbal elements such as handwriting style, spatial arrangement of words and the use of emoticons to convey emotion.
